titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Forasmuch as the Queenes Maiestie our soueraigne ladie, is crediblie enfourmed that the infection of the plague is at this present in sundry places in [and] about the Citie of London ...
Proclamations. 1570-09-24
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: In Powles Churchyarde by Richarde Iugge and Iohn Cawood, Printers to the Queenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A proclamation adjourning Michaelmas term because of the plague.
At bottom of sheet: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
